 There was a difference bewteen phsyical cleaniness and being 'ritualistically unclean'. However, part of the ritual cleansing was the immersion in water. They had huge places in the temple for people to immerse themselves. 
 
 JOhn the baptist , when using a modified cleaninsg ritutal in the Jordan, was extending this ritual to the people that normally would be considererred 'ritiualistically unclean'. The diseased, the lame, the mamzers.
 
 Jesus, as written in the New testament, would have been considered 'unclean', becaues his father was not his mothers husband.

 Well, I can assure you that people can 'smell' different. ALl that is needed is a change in diet. If someone gives up , for example, alcohol, they smell different. If someone transforms themselves to a vegetarian, they smell different. And, if someone who ate mainly veggies start eating meat, they smell different. Nothing supernatural about it.
